intro: Adenophora stenanthina f. crispata, commonly known as the crinkled bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves and bell-shaped flowers. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is native to regions of East Asia, including China and Korea. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. The foliage's unique texture makes it a visually appealing choice for horticultural collections.
